docs.title: AI Engineering Platform
docs.text: Infrastructure and tooling for AI Engineering bootcamps, providing secure, isolated development environments and automated participant onboarding.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This platform consists of the following components:

  1. Coder Deployment - Containerized development environments supported by Coder
  2. Participant Onboarding System - Secure, automated participant onboarding

docs.title: 1. Coder Deployment for GCP
docs.text: The coder folder contains all resources needed to deploy a Coder instance on Google Cloud Platform (GCP), along with reusable workspace templates and Docker images for the workspace environment.

docs.title: Structure
docs.text:
• deploy/ - Terraform scripts and startup automation for provisioning the Coder server on a GCP VM
  • docker/ - Dockerfiles and guides for building custom images used by Coder workspace templates
  • templates/ - Coder workspace templates for reproducible, containerized development environments on GCP

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
1. Provision Coder on GCP - Follow the steps in coder/deploy/README.md
  2. Build and Push Docker Images - See coder/docker/README.md
  3. Push Workspace Templates - See coder/templates/README.md

docs.title: 2. Participant Onboarding System
docs.text: Automated system for securely distributing team-specific API keys to bootcamp participants using Firebase Authentication and Firestore.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Secure Authentication - Firebase custom tokens with per-participant access
  • Team Isolation - Firestore security rules enforce team-level data separation
  • Automated Onboarding - One-command setup for participants
  • API Key Management - Automated generation and distribution of API keys

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text:
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                          Admin Phase                            │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  1. Setup teams and participants in Firestore                   │
│  2. Generate team-specific API keys and shared keys             │
│  3. Add users to github AI-Engineering-Platform org             │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
                              ↓
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                       Participant Phase                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  1. Run onboarding script in Coder workspace                    │
│  2. Script authenticates using token server                     │
│  3. Fetches team-specific API keys (security rules enforced)    │
│  4. Creates .env file with all credentials                      │
│  5. Runs integration tests to verify keys, marks onboard status │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

docs.title: CLI Reference
docs.text: The aieng-platform-onboard package provides a command-line tool for bootcamp participant onboarding, authentication, and environment setup.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: pip install aieng-platform-onboard

docs.title: onboard
docs.text: Main command for onboarding bootcamp participants with team-specific API keys.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: onboard [OPTIONS]

docs.title: Participant Onboarding
docs.text:
Standard onboarding flow for bootcamp participants:

onboard \
  --bootcamp-name fall-2025 \
  --gcp-project coderd \
  --test-script tests/integration/test_api_keys.py \
  --output-dir .

docs.title: Admin Status Report
docs.text:
View onboarding status for all participants (requires admin credentials):

onboard --admin-status-report --gcp-project coderd

docs.title: Required (for participant onboarding)
docs.text: Option Description Example --bootcamp-name Name of the bootcamp --bootcamp-name fall-2025 --test-script Path to integration test script --test-script tests/integration/test_api_keys.py

docs.title: Optional
docs.text: Option Description Default --gcp-project GCP project ID coderd --output-dir Directory for .env file . (current directory) --firebase-api-key Firebase Web API key for token exchange (from FIREBASE_WEB_API_KEY env var) --skip-test Skip integration tests False --force Force re-onboarding even if already onboarded False --admin-status-report Display onboarding status for all participants (admin only) False --version Show version number and exit -

docs.title: Onboarding Process
docs.text:
The participant onboarding flow consists of 9 steps:

  1. Identify Participant - Detects GitHub username from environment
  2. Fetch Authentication Token - Retrieves fresh token from service
  3. Connect to Firestore - Initializes secure Firestore connection
  4. Fetch Your Profile - Reads participant data and team assignment
  5. Fetch Team API Keys - Retrieves team-specific API keys
  6. Fetch Global Configuration - Fetches shared configuration keys
  7. Create Environment File - Generates .env file with all keys
  8. Run Integration Test - Validates API keys (optional)
  9. Mark as Onboarded - Updates participant status in Firestore

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
The following environment variables are used:

Variable Description Required GITHUB_USER GitHub username for authentication Yes FIREBASE_WEB_API_KEY Firebase Web API key (can be passed via --firebase-api-key) Yes GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS Path to GCP service account key (admin only) For --admin-status-report

docs.title: Exit Codes
docs.text: Code Description 0 Success 1 Failure (authentication, connection, or configuration error)

docs.title: Basic Onboarding
docs.text:
export GITHUB_USER=myusername
onboard \
  --bootcamp-name fall-2025 \
  --test-script tests/integration/test_api_keys.py

docs.title: Skip Integration Tests
docs.text:
onboard \
  --bootcamp-name fall-2025 \
  --test-script tests/integration/test_api_keys.py \
  --skip-test

docs.title: Force Re-onboarding
docs.text:
onboard \
  --bootcamp-name fall-2025 \
  --test-script tests/integration/test_api_keys.py \
  --force

docs.title: Custom Output Directory
docs.text:
onboard \
  --bootcamp-name fall-2025 \
  --test-script tests/integration/test_api_keys.py \
  --output-dir ~/my-bootcamp

docs.title: Admin Status Report
docs.text:
# Requires admin credentials (service account or gcloud auth)
gcloud auth application-default login
onboard --admin-status-report --gcp-project coderd

docs.title: .env File
docs.text:
The onboarding process creates a .env file containing:

  • Team-specific API keys (OpenAI/Gemini, Langfuse)
  • Global shared configuration
  • Bootcamp-specific settings

Location: Specified by --output-dir (default: current directory)

Usage: 

source .env

docs.title: Authentication Failures
docs.text:
• Ensure GITHUB_USER environment variable is set
  • Verify you're added to the participant list (contact admin)
  • Check token service is deployed and accessible

docs.title: Connection Failures
docs.text:
• Verify GCP project ID is correct
  • Check Firebase Web API key is valid
  • Ensure Firestore security rules allow participant access

docs.title: Integration Test Failures
docs.text:
• Check that .env file was created successfully
  • Verify API keys are valid (contact admin if needed)
  • Use --skip-test to bypass tests if keys need manual verification

docs.title: Admin Command Failures
docs.text:
• Ensure you're authenticated with proper GCP permissions: 
    gcloud auth application-default login
  • Or set GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS to service account key path
  • Verify you have Firestore read access for the project

docs.title: Support
docs.text: For issues or questions: - Contact your bootcamp administrator - Check existing .env file: cat .env - Re-run with --force to regenerate configuration
